Authors:
Guozhen Zhang, JiYe Yan, Ruvishika Shehali Jayawardena,
XingHong Li, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
An account of Colletotrichum species associated with
strawberry anthracnose in China based on morphology and molecular
data
Keywords:
C. nymphaeae crown rot molecular phylogenymorphology
pathogen
Abstract:
Strawberry anthracnose is an important disease in China
that results in significant economic losses. A number of Colletotrichum
species are known to be pathogens of strawberry. A survey of strawberry
fields in eight provinces of China was carried out to identify the
causal agents of strawberry anthracnose. The disease mainly causes crown
rot, leading to plant wilt and death in the nursery stage, after
transplanting in green house, which makes anthracnose a major threat to
strawberry production and quality. Multi-locus sequence analysis coupled
with morphological assessment revealed that the disease-associated taxa
belong to two Colletotrichum species complexes: Colletotrichum nymphaeae
(C. acutatum species complex), C. fructicola and C. chengpingense sp.
nov.(C. gloeosporioides species complex). The novel species is
introduced in this paper and illustrated. The new species is closely
related to C. theobromicola and pathogenicity tests proved that it is
pathogenic to the strawberry crown, fruits and leaves.
